intro: Sphaeralcea cuspidata, commonly known as the sharpcone globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its globular, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sphaeralcea cuspidata is an important plant for pollinators and is also used in restoration projects due to its adaptability and ecological value.
